metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22742 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When inserting text while in edit mode, some characters might have lead to out-of-bounds memory access causing a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.5, Firefox < 96, and Thunderbird < 91.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '96.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
